articles.title: In world first, artificial mouse 'embryos' were grown without the need for a womb, sperm, or egg - Business Insider South Africa
articles.description: The  "embryos" grew placentas and organs and could be used for research. We're still a long way before we can make humans embryos that way.
articles.content:
Scientists grew "synthetic embryos" from mice cells without using sperm, eggs, or a womb. 
The process, a world first, was described in an issue of the peer-reviewed journal Cell on August 1.
